page.title: 03Swanton Morley 3
page.content:
A significant number of women are employed at a turkey meat processing plant (Matthews Norfolk Turkeys) nearby. Casual, seasonal employment is also availably during the summer months, in the form of fruit picking.
The area as a whole is primarily one of rich farmland, concentrating on the production of wheat, barley and sugar beet.
The public house near the village green, the Papermakers, derives its name from the existence, in historical times, of a paper mill which stood beside the River Wensum. The other pub, the Angel, boasts connections with Abraham Lincoln. It was here that his grandparents lived before emigrating to America.
